urls.title: Hiring - Lex Fridman - Lex Fridman
urls.description: I am currently involved in several efforts: (A) podcast & videos, (B) research, (C) startup. This page (for now) is for help I need on effort A (and some B). Here are the positions I’m currently hiring for. Remote applications welcome. This page was updated on Dec 5, 2022. I’m planning to review applications and do interviews over the next 2 weeks. Contents1 Podcast Reviewer/Researcher & Virtual Assistant 2 Translation and/or Voice Overdubbing3 Video Editor4 Programmer/Webdev: Python, Javascript, PHP5 Machine Learning & Robotics Engineer6 Local Austin Camera Operator Podcast Reviewer/Researcher & Virtual Assistant  Description: Help with miscellaneous tasks, from podcast research

data.text:
@rohan1357 @david_dossett Thank you Rohan and David. Things I love:
- It's super fast
- It's intuitive to learn. I was at normal productivity in 3 days.
- Customization is easy
- Extensions are powerful

PS: I switched ML work, still need to switch webdev.

I wrote more on Reddit: https://t.co/o2X0o9UH5M https://t.co/Lh9MZRBGVd

I spent ~20,000+ hours programming in Emacs. I finally decided to switch to VSCode. It feels like saying goodbye to an old friend.

It's good to always be evolving, always willing to let go of the comfortable old way to discover a better new way.
The better angels of human nature will prevail.

urls.title: Making a Traversable Wormhole with a Quantum Computer
urls.description: Wormholes — wrinkles in the fabric of spacetime that connect two disparate locations — may seem like the stuff of science fiction. But whether or not they exist in reality, studying these hypothetical objects could be the key to making concrete the tantalizing link between information and matter that has bedeviled physicists for decades. Surprisingly, a quantum computer is an ideal platform to investigate this connection. The trick is to use a correspondence called AdS/CFT, which establishes an equivalence

tweets.text: In @Nature: making a traversable wormhole with a quantum computer. A qubit teleported across our Sycamore processor exhibits the dynamics expected from crossing a traversable wormhole, opening up possibilities to test quantum gravity theories. #GoogleAI  https://t.co/I8sofabj8r https://t.co/lgedcmDVm7
